actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 94-952.

official_title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act of 1968 by designating a segment of the New River as a potential component of the national wild and scenic rivers system.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 94-952) Designates, under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act, that segment of the New River in North Carolina extending from its confluence with Dog Creek downstream approximately 26.5 miles to the Virginia State line as a wild and scenic river. Provides that any licenses issued heretofore or hereafter by the Federal Power Commission affecting the New River of North Carolina shall be effective only outside the segment designated by this Act; and provides that no such licensed project shall invade, or otherwise adversely affect such segment.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act of 1968 by designating a segment of the New River as a potential component of the national wild and scenic rivers system.
